hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Liquidity Rotation on BTC Stability Post-Catalyst
hypothesis_content.statement: After a BTC-specific positive catalyst (e.g., ETF news, halving) where BTC price rallies then consolidates in a tight range (+/- 1.5%) for 12 hours, capital rotates into high-beta, high-liquidity altcoins (ETH, SOL) with a 6-18 hour lag, amplifying the total crypto market move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC leads on new information. Once it stabilizes at a higher level, it signals 'all-clear' for broader risk. Traders and algorithms seeking higher returns rotate into altcoins, creating an amplified, lagged wave of buying. The stability period confirms the BTC move is not a flash pump.
entry_conditions: BTC-specific positive catalyst identified (headline, major buy order)
BTC rallies >5% on the catalyst, then trades in a +/-1.5% range for 12 consecutive hours
BTC dominance (BTC.D) shows a slight downtick over that 12h period
Enter a basket of ETH and SOL upon a 4-hour close where the ALT/BTC ratio (for the basket) breaks above its 20-period MA

exit_conditions.take_profit: ALT/BTC ratio reaches a 5% gain, OR total crypto market cap increases by 8% from rotation entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: No statistically significant outperformance of the ETH/SOL basket vs. BTC in the 36 hours following the defined BTC stability period after a catalyst.
